title: Town hall
summary:
In local government, a city hall, town hall, civic centre (in the UK or Australia), guildhall, or a municipal building (in the Philippines), is the chief administrative building of a city,[2] town, or other municipality. It usually houses the city or town council, its associated departments, and their employees. It also usually functions as the base of the mayor of a city, town, borough, county or shire. 
Other terms in non-English languages are Mairie or Hôtel de ville (France), Gemeindehaus or Rathaus (Germany), Rådhus (Denmark), Paços do Concelho (Portugal) and Stadshus (Sweden).
